##
briankrebs@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-12T14:07:04.000Z ##

Reason #2,391 why revisiting security assumptions is always a good idea.

[Bimi] No cryptographic connection between VMC and DKIM key

https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/bimi/Ba3jFfJ8K6ic7qg4DzPsIsGW5UY/

My favorite part:

"I guess some may consider what I just said as an unimportant or a merely theoretical issue, so I would like to illustrate it with an example. Let's take the domain entrust.com. It has a DKIM key
configured at "dkim._domainkey.entrust.com". The TXT record is the following:

"v=DKIM1; k=rsa;
p=MIGfMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4GNADCBiQKBgQCyGF0xzO7Eig1H8QdIErjEKOGnIVvoLU5VjcMRBRWZK65NinL+gVnjuMD2mYdjC3f+7sQCWxGDSKIFn/bB+iXxO2x1/ktkwXHQfQ/9FcFuy+LE0Snsm0SwXN/2l1m5f9e1xdswC+dzHt6DIpDSDENsRal019YKQTqwVyB++7QORwIDAQAB"

This is a 1024 bit RSA key, which is not up to modern standards. But breaking 1024 bit RSA is still only feasible for very powerful attackers. However, this key has another problem: it is vulnerable to
the Debian OpenSSL bug (CVE-2008-0166). It is trivially possible to
find the private key (you can use my tool badkeys -
https://badkeys.info/ - to do that):

https://github.com/badkeys/debianopenssl/blob/main/rsa1024/ssl/le32/25731-rnd.key"

##

CVE-2023-6345
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 5.33%

updated 2024-02-09T05:11:29

1 posts

Integer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 119.0.6045.199 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a malicious file. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-11T15:30:42.000Z ##

Google Project Zero: CVE-2023-6345: Integer overflow in Skia MeshOp::onCombineIfPossible
This was published 3 weeks ago on 18 April 2024, but it's great to learn about exploited zero-day vulnerabilities: CVE-2023-6345 (9.6 critical, disclosed 28 November 2023 by Google as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 30 November 2023) is an integer overflow leading to a heap out of bounds write. It allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a malicious file. Benoît Sevens and Clement Lecigne of Google Threat Analysis Group, who originally reported the zero-day, provided a root cause analysis and proof of concept exploit. The RCA is extremely thorough in dissecting and comparing the exploit, then recommendations for preventing/mitigating the vulnerability. I would love if all companies structured vulnerability analyses this way.

#CVE_2023_6345 #GoogleProjectZero #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #rootcauseanalysis

# Summary Log4j versions prior to 2.16.0 are subject to a remote code execution vulnerability via the ldap JNDI parser. As per [Apache's Log4j security guide](https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/security.html): Apache Log4j2 <=2.14.1 JNDI features used in configuration, log messages, and parameters do not protect against attacker controlled LDAP and other JNDI related endpoints. An attacker who

screaminggoat at 2024-05-16T14:34:19.966Z ##

Uptycs: New Threat Detected: Inside Our Discovery of the Log4j Campaign and Its XMRig Malware
Unknown financially-motivated threat actors have been exploiting Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228 (10.0 critical, disclosed 10 December 2021 by Apache as an exploited zero-day in Log4j 2) to deploy XMRig cryptominers since January 2024. Affected countries include China (top), followed by Hong Kong, Netherlands, Japan, United States, Germany, South Africa, and Sweden. Four distinct sets of servers establish communication with compromised IP and send shell scripts for XMRig deployment, or disseminating Mirai or Gafgyt malware. IOC provided.

#threatintel #CVE_2021_44228 #Log4Shell #Log4j #IOC #XMrig #mirai #gafgyt

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-16T14:34:19.000Z ##

Uptycs: New Threat Detected: Inside Our Discovery of the Log4j Campaign and Its XMRig Malware
Unknown financially-motivated threat actors have been exploiting Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228 (10.0 critical, disclosed 10 December 2021 by Apache as an exploited zero-day in Log4j 2) to deploy XMRig cryptominers since January 2024. Affected countries include China (top), followed by Hong Kong, Netherlands, Japan, United States, Germany, South Africa, and Sweden. Four distinct sets of servers establish communication with compromised IP and send shell scripts for XMRig deployment, or disseminating Mirai or Gafgyt malware. IOC provided.

##

CVE-2024-23109
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-02-05T15:30:29

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in an os command ('os command injection') in Fortinet FortiSIEM version 7.1.0 through 7.1.1 and 7.0.0 through 7.0.2 and 6.7.0 through 6.7.8 and 6.6.0 through 6.6.3 and 6.5.0 through 6.5.2 and 6.4.0 through 6.4.2 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via via crafted API requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.747Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T12:18:06.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2023-34992: Fortinet FortiSIEM Command Injection Deep-Dive
Horizon3 provides a vulnerability analysis and proof of concept for CVE-2023-34992 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 October 2023 by Fortinet) OS Command injection vulnerability in FortiSIEM supervisor due to improper neutralization of special elements.

Sidenote: This is the same 23 October 2023 security advisory that Fortinet buried two additional vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 have a perfect score of 10.0 cc: @cR0w) on 06 February 2024. When @serghei of Bleeping Computer asked about it, "Fortinet told me these two are duplicates of the original CVE-2023-34992. Fortinet says they got accidentally added and pushed to NVD automatically because of an API issue they're investigating."
Zach Hanley (who submitted all of these vulnerabilities and Horizon3's blog post) disputed what Fortinet said, posting a Twitter screenshot showing email communication between him and PSIRT Ticketing* System showing confirmation for CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109: "Lol not sure whats going on over there, but they're real were a bypass of the 2023 CVE it got added to."
Fortinet then updated the security advisory sometime around 08-09 February 2024, crediting Zach Hanley/Horizon3 and backdating the update to 31 January 2024.

as @catsalad said in a previous toot, recommend temporary fix is to "Just pull the power"

#CVE_2023_34992 #proofofconcept #CVE #Fortinet #vulnerability #fortisiem

##

CVE-2023-46747
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.12%

updated 2024-02-01T02:15:55.817000

1 posts

Undisclosed requests may bypass configuration utility authentication, allowing an attacker with network access to the BIG-IP system through the management port and/or self IP addresses to execute arbitrary system commands.  Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

Nuclei template

10 repos

https://github.com/maniak-academy/Mitigate-CVE-2023-46747

https://github.com/bijaysenihang/CVE-2023-46747-Mass-RCE

https://github.com/AliBrTab/CVE-2023-46747-POC

https://github.com/RevoltSecurities/CVE-2023-46747

https://github.com/y4v4z/CVE-2023-46747-POC

https://github.com/vidura2/cve-2023-46747

https://github.com/rainbowhatrkn/CVE-2023-46747-RCE

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2023-46747-RCE

https://github.com/nvansluis/test_cve-2023-46747

https://github.com/fu2x2000/CVE-2023-46747

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T21:44:54.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities CVE-2024-21793 and CVE-2024-26026:

  • F5 BIG-IP has 5 CVEs in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:
    • CVE-2023-46747 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Authentication Bypass
    • CVE-2023-46748 (8.8 high) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility SQL Injection
    • CVE-2022-1388 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Missing Authentication
    • CVE-2021-22991 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Buffer Overflow
    • CVE-2021-22986 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP and BIG-IQ Centralized Management iControl REST Remote Code Execution
    • CVE-2020-5902 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) Remote Code Execution
  • Several of these F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities were known to be exploited during ransomware campaigns: CVE-2022-1388, CVE-2021-22986, and CVE-2020-5902.
  • F5 BIG-IP was so extensively exploited at one point that CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory on 12 October 2022: Threat Actors Exploiting F5 BIG-IP CVE-2022-1388 (AA22-138A)
  • CISA also put out a cybersecurity advisory for another massively exploited F5 BIG-IP CVE on 24 July 2020: Threat Actor Exploitation of F5 BIG-IP CVE-2020-5902 (AA20-206A). That one was so bad that CISA created a Guidance for F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability Fact Sheet.
  • People’s Republic of China state-sponsored cyber actors LOVE F5 BIG-IP. According to CISA in the cybersecurity advisory Top CVEs Actively Exploited By People’s Republic of China State-Sponsored Cyber Actors published 06 October 2022, CVE-2020-5902 and CVE-2022-1388 are among the top 20!
  • Mandiant mentioned on 21 March 2024 that PRC actor UNC5174 likes CVE-2023-46747: Bringing Access Back — Initial Access Brokers Exploit F5 BIG-IP (CVE-2023-46747) and ScreenConnect.
  • Vulnerabilities with public proofs of concept are more likely to be exploited. Oh hey, Eclypsium provided the exploits. The same day.

cc: @todb

EPSS: 94.57%

updated 2024-01-31T18:31:21

3 posts

NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect before version 4.4.1 is vulnerable to unauthenticated remote code execution. Note that this vulnerability is caused by the incomplete patch of CVE-2023-37679.

Nuclei template

2 repos

https://github.com/K3ysTr0K3R/CVE-2023-43208-EXPLOIT

screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T16:33:04.843Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

#CVE_2024_4947 #CVE_2023_43208 #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #CVE #activeexploitation #vulnerability #zeroday #Chrome #Mirth #NextGen #MirthConnect

  • CVE-2024-4947 (CVSSv3 score pending, disclosed 15 May 2024 by Google as an exploited zero-day) Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-43208 (9.8 critical, disclosed 26 October 2023 by NextGen) NextGen Healthcare Mirth Connect Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability

Exploitation reports:

  • CVE-2024-4947: 15 May 2024 "Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-4947 exists in the wild."
  • CVE-2023-43208: 07 March 2024 "It seems we were attacked by this vulnerability in Mirth Connect Server"

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-09T14:55:05.000Z ##

Juniper Networks: Protecting Networks from Opportunistic Ivanti Pulse Secure Vulnerability Exploitation
Juniper Threat Labs warns of exploitation attempts against Ivanti Connect Secure/Policy Secure CVE-2023-46805 (8.2 high) and CVE-2024-21887 (9.1 critical) in order to add compromised devices to the Mirai botnet. Juniper describes the payload and infection chain, then provides IOC.

See related The Hacker News reporting: Mirai Botnet Exploits Ivanti Connect Secure Flaws for Malicious Payload Delivery

#threatintel #IOC #Mirai #botnet #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887

##

CVE-2023-6549
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.60%

updated 2024-01-17T21:30:30

2 posts

Denial of Service

screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T15:36:25.538Z ##

Citrix security advisory update: NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway Security Bulletin for CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549
Following Bishop Fox's blog post about an unassigned OOB Memory Read vulnerability affecting Netscaler ADC and Gateway (see parent toot above), Citrix updates their security advisory for CVE-2023-6549 (8.2 high, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Citrix, added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 17 January 2024). Originally a buffer overflow vulnerability in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway leading to denial of service (DoS), it now includes the verbiage "Out-Of-Bounds Memory Read".

cc: @todb @ntkramer

#CVE_2023_6549 #Citrix #vulnerability #Netscaler #CitrixADC

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:36:25.000Z ##

Originally a buffer overflow vulnerability in NetScaler ADC and NetScaler Gateway leading to denial of service (DoS), it now includes the verbiage "Out-Of-Bounds Memory Read".

CVE-2022-25878
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.15%

updated 2023-11-29T22:15:55

1 posts

The package protobufjs is vulnerable to Prototype Pollution, which can allow an attacker to add/modify properties of the Object.prototype. Versions after and including 6.10.0 until 6.10.3 and after and including 6.11.0 until 6.11.3 are vulnerable. This vulnerability can occur in multiple ways: 1. by providing untrusted user input to util.setProperty or to ReflectionObject.setParsedOption function

(8.8 HIGH)

updated 2023-11-24T05:05:35

1 posts

An authenticated SQL injection vulnerability exists in the BIG-IP Configuration utility which may allow an authenticated attacker with network access to the Configuration utility through the BIG-IP management port and/or self IP addresses to execute arbitrary system commands.  Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T21:44:54.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities CVE-2024-21793 and CVE-2024-26026:

  • F5 BIG-IP has 5 CVEs in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:
    • CVE-2023-46747 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Authentication Bypass
    • CVE-2023-46748 (8.8 high) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility SQL Injection
    • CVE-2022-1388 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Missing Authentication
    • CVE-2021-22991 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Buffer Overflow
    • CVE-2021-22986 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP and BIG-IQ Centralized Management iControl REST Remote Code Execution
    • CVE-2020-5902 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) Remote Code Execution
  • Several of these F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities were known to be exploited during ransomware campaigns: CVE-2022-1388, CVE-2021-22986, and CVE-2020-5902.
  • F5 BIG-IP was so extensively exploited at one point that CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory on 12 October 2022: Threat Actors Exploiting F5 BIG-IP CVE-2022-1388 (AA22-138A)
  • CISA also put out a cybersecurity advisory for another massively exploited F5 BIG-IP CVE on 24 July 2020: Threat Actor Exploitation of F5 BIG-IP CVE-2020-5902 (AA20-206A). That one was so bad that CISA created a Guidance for F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability Fact Sheet.
  • People’s Republic of China state-sponsored cyber actors LOVE F5 BIG-IP. According to CISA in the cybersecurity advisory Top CVEs Actively Exploited By People’s Republic of China State-Sponsored Cyber Actors published 06 October 2022, CVE-2020-5902 and CVE-2022-1388 are among the top 20!
  • Mandiant mentioned on 21 March 2024 that PRC actor UNC5174 likes CVE-2023-46747: Bringing Access Back — Initial Access Brokers Exploit F5 BIG-IP (CVE-2023-46747) and ScreenConnect.
  • Vulnerabilities with public proofs of concept are more likely to be exploited. Oh hey, Eclypsium provided the exploits. The same day.

##

CVE-2023-36033
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-11-14T18:30:28

6 posts

Windows DWM Core Library Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T21:03:30.579Z ##

@dreadpir8robots The five alarm fire is definitely CVE-2024-30051 for sure. Kaspersky states that they discovered an exploitation guide regarding a Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) vulnerability uploaded to VirusTotal. And while the described exploitation process is identical to CVE-2023-36033, the vulnerability was different (new): https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

We have seen it used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

In your blog post, I think it ought to be mentioned that CVE-2024-30046 is only considered a zero-day because it's marked Publicly Disclosed. https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-30046

#CVE_2024_30051 #CVE_2024_30046 #PatchTuesday #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T17:23:03.524Z ##

Kaspersky writes a related blog post about one of the zero-days: QakBot attacks with Windows zero-day (CVE-2024-30051)
The blog post details how a document uploaded to VirusTotal on 01 April 2024 described an exploitation process for Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) identical to CVE-2023-36033 but with a different vulnerability. Kaspersky identified that an exploit was used together with QakBot and other malware, and believe that multiple threat actors have access to it.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @mttaggart @deepthoughts10

#CVE_2024_30051 #PatchTuesday #eitw #vulnerability #zeroday #activeexploitation #Microsoft #MSRC

##

🔗️ [Securelist] https://securelist.com/cve-2024-30051/112618/

CVE-2020-5902
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.56%

updated 2023-11-14T03:15:07.810000

1 posts

In BIG-IP versions 15.0.0-15.1.0.3, 14.1.0-14.1.2.5, 13.1.0-13.1.3.3, 12.1.0-12.1.5.1, and 11.6.1-11.6.5.1, the Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI), also referred to as the Configuration utility, has a Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability in undisclosed pages.

https://github.com/dwisiswant0/CVE-2020-5902

https://github.com/yassineaboukir/CVE-2020-5902

https://github.com/wdlid/CVE-2020-5902-fix

https://github.com/halencarjunior/f5scan

https://github.com/nsflabs/CVE-2020-5902

https://github.com/ludy-dev/BIG-IP-F5-TMUI-RCE-Vulnerability

https://github.com/corelight/CVE-2020-5902-F5BigIP

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T21:44:54.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities CVE-2024-21793 and CVE-2024-26026:

  • F5 BIG-IP has 5 CVEs in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:
    • CVE-2023-46747 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Authentication Bypass
    • CVE-2023-46748 (8.8 high) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility SQL Injection
    • CVE-2022-1388 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Missing Authentication
    • CVE-2021-22991 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Buffer Overflow
    • CVE-2021-22986 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP and BIG-IQ Centralized Management iControl REST Remote Code Execution
    • CVE-2020-5902 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) Remote Code Execution
  • Several of these F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities were known to be exploited during ransomware campaigns: CVE-2022-1388, CVE-2021-22986, and CVE-2020-5902.
  • F5 BIG-IP was so extensively exploited at one point that CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory on 12 October 2022: Threat Actors Exploiting F5 BIG-IP CVE-2022-1388 (AA22-138A)
  • CISA also put out a cybersecurity advisory for another massively exploited F5 BIG-IP CVE on 24 July 2020: Threat Actor Exploitation of F5 BIG-IP CVE-2020-5902 (AA20-206A). That one was so bad that CISA created a Guidance for F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability Fact Sheet.
  • People’s Republic of China state-sponsored cyber actors LOVE F5 BIG-IP. According to CISA in the cybersecurity advisory Top CVEs Actively Exploited By People’s Republic of China State-Sponsored Cyber Actors published 06 October 2022, CVE-2020-5902 and CVE-2022-1388 are among the top 20!
  • Mandiant mentioned on 21 March 2024 that PRC actor UNC5174 likes CVE-2023-46747: Bringing Access Back — Initial Access Brokers Exploit F5 BIG-IP (CVE-2023-46747) and ScreenConnect.
  • Vulnerabilities with public proofs of concept are more likely to be exploited. Oh hey, Eclypsium provided the exploits. The same day.

cc: @todb

##

CVE-2022-1388
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.48%

updated 2023-11-02T01:54:15.380000

1 posts

On F5 BIG-IP 16.1.x versions prior to 16.1.2.2, 15.1.x versions prior to 15.1.5.1, 14.1.x versions prior to 14.1.4.6, 13.1.x versions prior to 13.1.5, and all 12.1.x and 11.6.x versions, undisclosed requests may bypass iControl REST authentication. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T21:44:54.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities CVE-2024-21793 and CVE-2024-26026:

  • F5 BIG-IP has 5 CVEs in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:
    • CVE-2023-46747 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Authentication Bypass
    • CVE-2023-46748 (8.8 high) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility SQL Injection
    • CVE-2022-1388 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Missing Authentication
    • CVE-2021-22991 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Buffer Overflow
    • CVE-2021-22986 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP and BIG-IQ Centralized Management iControl REST Remote Code Execution
    • CVE-2020-5902 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) Remote Code Execution
  • Several of these F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities were known to be exploited during ransomware campaigns: CVE-2022-1388, CVE-2021-22986, and CVE-2020-5902.
  • F5 BIG-IP was so extensively exploited at one point that CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory on 12 October 2022: Threat Actors Exploiting F5 BIG-IP CVE-2022-1388 (AA22-138A)
  • CISA also put out a cybersecurity advisory for another massively exploited F5 BIG-IP CVE on 24 July 2020: Threat Actor Exploitation of F5 BIG-IP CVE-2020-5902 (AA20-206A). That one was so bad that CISA created a Guidance for F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability Fact Sheet.
  • People’s Republic of China state-sponsored cyber actors LOVE F5 BIG-IP. According to CISA in the cybersecurity advisory Top CVEs Actively Exploited By People’s Republic of China State-Sponsored Cyber Actors published 06 October 2022, CVE-2020-5902 and CVE-2022-1388 are among the top 20!
  • Mandiant mentioned on 21 March 2024 that PRC actor UNC5174 likes CVE-2023-46747: Bringing Access Back — Initial Access Brokers Exploit F5 BIG-IP (CVE-2023-46747) and ScreenConnect.
  • Vulnerabilities with public proofs of concept are more likely to be exploited. Oh hey, Eclypsium provided the exploits. The same day.

cc: @todb

CVE-2023-3824
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.08%

updated 2023-10-27T18:58:24.280000

1 posts

In PHP version 8.0.* before 8.0.30,  8.1.* before 8.1.22, and 8.2.* before 8.2.8, when loading phar file, while reading PHAR directory entries, insufficient length checking may lead to a stack buffer overflow, leading potentially to memory corruption or RCE.

pentesttools@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-09T10:46:26.000Z ##

💥 Did you know we introduced these crucial detections in our Network Scanner last month? 👉 Here's how to get even farther-reaching findings:

🎯 Publicly exposed VNC, MSSQL & LDAP services - findings now flag if these services are publicly accessible on the Internet, so you can tighten your network's security posture ➡️ available with your free plan

🎯 CVE-2023-3824 (CVSSv3 9.8) - added detection for the stack buffer overflow in PHP that leads to RCE

🎯 CVE-2023-44487 (CVSSv3 7.5) - we enhanced detection accuracy for HTTP/2 Rapid Reset by checking if the target supports the HTTP/2 protocol and the HTTP/2 RST_STREAM directive

🎯 Comprehensive DNS records - see a new finding when a target has DNS records available (A, AAAA, MX, NS, SOA, TXT, SPF, CAA, CNAME) and get deeper visibility into the target’s domain structure. ➡️ available with your free plan

CVE-2023-30576
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.21%

updated 2023-06-14T14:33:16.713000

2 posts

Apache Guacamole 0.9.10 through 1.5.1 may continue to reference a freed RDP audio input buffer. Depending on timing, this may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the guacd process.

1 repos

#search_error

Parallelism can be quite challenging - Our latest blog post covers a severe Use-After-Free vulnerability in Apache Guacamole (CVE-2023-30576).

Join us in diving into the world of glibc heap exploitation in a multi-threaded environment:

CVE-2023-28450
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.24%

updated 2023-04-17T03:30:19

2 posts

An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T16:32:54.420Z ##

DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T22:12:55.000Z ##

Der Spiegel: Kevin Kühnerts Postfach von russischen Hackern angegriffen (German, paywall)
Der Spiegel reports that Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) General Secretary Kevin Kühnert was one of the main victims of the APT28 2023 cyberattacks with his email inbox being targeted. "the attack occurred in December 2022, earlier than previously known."
While CVE-2023-23397 (9.8 critical, disclosed 14 March 2023 by Microsoft) is not explicitly mentioned in the article, they state "The vulnerability was rated 9.8 out of 10 and has apparently been exploited since April 2022." Hakan Tanriverdi (@hatr) also references it in his toot.
Der Spiegel said digital forensics turned up nothing due to the length of time passed: "However, according to SPIEGEL information, it was apparently no longer possible to find and analyze sufficient log files to accurately reconstruct the case."

#Germany #Russia #cyberspionage #news #APT28 #ForestBlizzard #FancyBear #CVE_2023_23397

https://github.com/cybernetwiz/CVE-2023-23752

https://github.com/wibuheker/Joomla-CVE-2023-23752

https://github.com/gunzf0x/CVE-2023-23752

iamdtms@mas.to at 2024-05-21T18:50:41.000Z ##

Joomla 4.2.8 Information Disclosure ≈ Packet Storm
https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/178651/CVE-2023-23752.sh.txt

##

CVE-2018-5158
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.95%

updated 2023-02-02T05:03:34

2 posts

The PDF viewer does not sufficiently sanitize PostScript calculator functions, allowing malicious JavaScript to be injected through a crafted PDF file. This JavaScript can then be run with the permissions of the PDF viewer by its worker. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 52.8 and Firefox < 60.

2 repos

https://github.com/puzzle-tools/-CVE-2018-5158.pdf

https://github.com/ppcrab/CVE-2018-5158

WPalant at 2024-05-20T13:21:30.919Z ##

@screaminggoat Oh, just great… I noted the dangerous glyph handling in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1452075 a.k.a. CVE-2018-5158 six years ago. Not immediately obvious whether the checks added to compileGlyph back then were insufficient or degraded over time due to refactoring. 🙄

##
WPalant@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T13:21:30.000Z ##

@screaminggoat Oh, just great… I noted the dangerous glyph handling in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1452075 a.k.a. CVE-2018-5158 six years ago. Not immediately obvious whether the checks added to compileGlyph back then were insufficient or degraded over time due to refactoring. 🙄

##

CVE-2019-0604
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.40%

updated 2023-02-01T05:07:51

4 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Microsoft SharePoint when the software fails to check the source markup of an application package, aka 'Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-0594.

8 repos

https://github.com/Gh0st0ne/weaponized-0604

https://github.com/m5050/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/davidlebr1/cve-2019-0604-SP2010-netv3.5

https://github.com/k8gege/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/likescam/CVE-2019-0604_sharepoint_CVE

https://github.com/boxhg/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/linhlhq/CVE-2019-0604

https://github.com/MayankPandey01/Sparty-2.0

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T01:03:21.393Z ##

@campuscodi I think it's important to note that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) was known to target CVE-2019-0604, a SharePoint (Server) RCE vulnerability in attacks on both Albania and Israel. If we were to build an APT threat actor profile, we can list this CVE as their preferred Exploit Public Facing Application of choice.

The language Check Point Research used implied that Scarred Manticore will pass off the final actions on objective (wiper/encryption/data destruction) to Void Manticore (aka Storm-0842) as the "closer."

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-20T11:58:51.442Z ##

Check Point Research: Bad Karma, No Justice: Void Manticore Destructive Activities In Israel
Check Point Research reports on the Iranian threat actor “Void Manticore” (aka Storm-0842) who they state is affiliated with the Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS). Void Manticore operates several online personas, from Homeland Justice for attacks in Albania, and Karma for attacks carried out in Israel. Void Manticore utilizes five different methods to conduct disruptive operations against its victims. This includes several custom wipers for both Windows and Linux, alongside manual deletion of files and shared drives. Void Manticore and Scarred Manticore have target overlaps and there are indications of systematic hand off of targets between those two groups (Void handles the rest). IOC and Yara rules provided.

Check Point offhandedly mentioned that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) exploits CVE-2019-0604 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 February 2019 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution for initial access.

#VoidManticore #cyberespionage #Iran #threatintel #Storm0842 #Oilrig #APT34 #IOC #Yara #CVE_2019_0604

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T01:03:21.000Z ##

@campuscodi I think it's important to note that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) was known to target CVE-2019-0604, a SharePoint (Server) RCE vulnerability in attacks on both Albania and Israel. If we were to build an APT threat actor profile, we can list this CVE as their preferred Exploit Public Facing Application of choice.

The language Check Point Research used implied that Scarred Manticore will pass off the final actions on objective (wiper/encryption/data destruction) to Void Manticore (aka Storm-0842) as the "closer."

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-20T11:58:51.000Z ##

Check Point Research: Bad Karma, No Justice: Void Manticore Destructive Activities In Israel
Check Point Research reports on the Iranian threat actor “Void Manticore” (aka Storm-0842) who they state is affiliated with the Ministry of Intelligence and Security (MOIS). Void Manticore operates several online personas, from Homeland Justice for attacks in Albania, and Karma for attacks carried out in Israel. Void Manticore utilizes five different methods to conduct disruptive operations against its victims. This includes several custom wipers for both Windows and Linux, alongside manual deletion of files and shared drives. Void Manticore and Scarred Manticore have target overlaps and there are indications of systematic hand off of targets between those two groups (Void handles the rest). IOC and Yara rules provided.

Check Point offhandedly mentioned that Scarred Manticore (aka OilRig, APT34, EUROPIUM, Hazel Sandstorm) exploits CVE-2019-0604 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 February 2019 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft SharePoint Remote Code Execution for initial access.

#VoidManticore #cyberespionage #Iran #threatintel #Storm0842 #Oilrig #APT34 #IOC #Yara #CVE_2019_0604

CVE-2021-30563(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.37%

updated 2023-01-30T05:01:13

2 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T22:59:57.141Z ##

@ligniform yeah, previous Type Confusion in V8 based Chromium vulnerabilities were present in Edge e.g. CVE-2021-30563

The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T22:59:57.000Z ##

@ligniform yeah, previous Type Confusion in V8 based Chromium vulnerabilities were present in Edge e.g. CVE-2021-30563

The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).

@ariadne What about CVE-2021-30139? That's essentially an out-of-bounds read and hence a spatial memory safety violation.

##

CVE-2021-22986
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.44%

updated 2023-01-27T05:03:12

1 posts

On BIG-IP versions 16.0.x before 16.0.1.1, 15.1.x before 15.1.2.1, 14.1.x before 14.1.4, 13.1.x before 13.1.3.6, and 12.1.x before 12.1.5.3 amd BIG-IQ 7.1.0.x before 7.1.0.3 and 7.0.0.x before 7.0.0.2, the iControl REST interface has an unauthenticated remote command execution vulnerability. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Software Development (EoSD) are not evaluated.

Nuclei template

16 repos

https://github.com/1n7erface/PocList

https://github.com/DDestinys/CVE-2021-22986

https://github.com/huydung26/CVE-2021-22986

https://github.com/ZephrFish/CVE-2021-22986_Check

https://github.com/yaunsky/CVE-202122986-EXP

https://github.com/dorkerdevil/CVE-2021-22986-Poc

https://github.com/dotslashed/CVE-2021-22986

https://github.com/amitlttwo/CVE-2021-22986

https://github.com/S1xHcL/f5_rce_poc

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-08T21:44:54.000Z ##

Why you should care about the new F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities CVE-2024-21793 and CVE-2024-26026:

  • F5 BIG-IP has 5 CVEs in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:
    • CVE-2023-46747 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Authentication Bypass
    • CVE-2023-46748 (8.8 high) F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility SQL Injection
    • CVE-2022-1388 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Missing Authentication
    • CVE-2021-22991 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Buffer Overflow
    • CVE-2021-22986 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP and BIG-IQ Centralized Management iControl REST Remote Code Execution
    • CVE-2020-5902 (9.8 critical) F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) Remote Code Execution
  • Several of these F5 BIG-IP vulnerabilities were known to be exploited during ransomware campaigns: CVE-2022-1388, CVE-2021-22986, and CVE-2020-5902.
  • F5 BIG-IP was so extensively exploited at one point that CISA put out a cybersecurity advisory on 12 October 2022: Threat Actors Exploiting F5 BIG-IP CVE-2022-1388 (AA22-138A)
  • CISA also put out a cybersecurity advisory for another massively exploited F5 BIG-IP CVE on 24 July 2020: Threat Actor Exploitation of F5 BIG-IP CVE-2020-5902 (AA20-206A). That one was so bad that CISA created a Guidance for F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability Fact Sheet.
  • People’s Republic of China state-sponsored cyber actors LOVE F5 BIG-IP. According to CISA in the cybersecurity advisory Top CVEs Actively Exploited By People’s Republic of China State-Sponsored Cyber Actors published 06 October 2022, CVE-2020-5902 and CVE-2022-1388 are among the top 20!
  • Mandiant mentioned on 21 March 2024 that PRC actor UNC5174 likes CVE-2023-46747: Bringing Access Back — Initial Access Brokers Exploit F5 BIG-IP (CVE-2023-46747) and ScreenConnect.
  • Vulnerabilities with public proofs of concept are more likely to be exploited. Oh hey, Eclypsium provided the exploits. The same day.

cc: @todb

##

CVE-2024-30056

screaminggoat at 2024-05-18T12:10:16.073Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): CVE-2024-30056 - Security Update Guide
This one slipped through the cracks: CVE-2024-30056 (7.1 high)
Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability. Weakness: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor. The 3 FAQ answers provide context as to how to exploit the vulnerability. Not publicly disclosed, not exploited, exploitation less likely.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.519Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

#CVE #Git #vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-15T15:50:58.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Git: Securing Git: Addressing 5 new vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-32002 (9.1 critical) Recursive clones on case-insensitive filesystems that support symlinks are susceptible to Remote Code Execution
  • CVE-2024-32004 (8.2 high) Remote Code Execution while cloning special-crafted local repositories
  • CVE-2024-32465 (7.4 high) Protections for cloning untrusted repositories can be bypassed
  • CVE-2024-32020 (3.9 low) Cloning local repository by untrusted user allows the untrusted user to modify objects in the cloned repository at will
  • CVE-2024-32021 (3.9 low) Local clone may hardlink arbitrary user-readable files into the new repository's "objects/" directory

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google ain't catchin me sleepin. They have another patch for 6 vulnerabilities, 4 externally reported, all high severity. No mention of exploitation.

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T17:25:34.318Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29823 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29824 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29825 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29826 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29827 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29828 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29829 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29830 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-29846 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

Ivanti security advisory: Security Advisory May 2024
16 vulnerabilities across 5 Ivanti products. No exploitation but EVERYTHING is critical and high severity. See related blog post: May Security Update

  • Ivanti Avalanche:
    • CVE-2024-29848 (7.2 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Neurons for ITSM:
    • CVE-2024-22059 (8.8 high) SQL injection vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-22060 (8.7 high) unrestricted file upload vulnerability
  • Ivanti Connect Secure
    • CVE-2023-38551 (8.2 high) CRLF Injection vulnerability
  • Ivanti Secure Access
    • CVE-2023-38042 (7.8 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
    • CVE-2023-46810 (7.3 high) local privilege escalation vulnerability
  • Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
    • CVE-2024-29822 (9.6 critical) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-29829 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

    • CVE-2024-29846 (8.4 high) unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability

##

CVE-2023-49206
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-05-21T16:32:54.420Z ##

DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-21T16:32:54.000Z ##

DNSBomb has a website!: https://dnsbomb.net/ h/t: @shellsharks Assigned vulnerabilities associated with it:

  • Industry-wide: CVE-2024-33655
  • Knot: CVE-2023-49206
  • Simple DNS Plus: CVE-2023-49205
  • Technitium:
    • CVE-2023-28456
    • CVE-2023-49203
  • MaraDNS: CVE-2023-49204
  • Dnsmasq:
    • CVE-2023-28450 (7.5 high) An issue was discovered in Dnsmasq before 2.90. The default maximum EDNS.0 UDP packet size was set to 4096 but should be 1232 because of DNS Flag Day 2020.
    • CVE-2023-49207
  • CoreDNS:
    • CVE-2023-28454
    • CVE-2023-49202
  • SDNS: CVE-2023-49201

#DoS #DNSBomb

##

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-05-21T15:20:04.000Z ##

GitHub warns of SAML auth bypass flaw in Enterprise Server

GitHub has fixed a maximum severity (CVSS v4 score: 10.0) authentication bypass vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-4986, which impacts GitHub...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/github-warns-of-saml-auth-bypass-flaw-in-enterprise-server/

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-20T23:45:22.000Z ##

Security firm Redline has published a write-up and PoC on CVE-2024-22026, a local privilege escalation vulnerability in Ivanti Enterprise Mobility Management Platform (EPMM) (formerly MobileIron) servers.

https://www.redlinecybersecurity.com/blog/exploiting-cve-2024-22026-rooting-ivanti-epmm-mobileiron-core

https://github.com/securekomodo/CVE-2024-22026

##

CVE-2024-28182
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/lockness-Ko/CVE-2024-27316

screaminggoat at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.238Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer
  • FG-IR-24-120 HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Frames Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-27316 for Apache HTTP Server (httpd)
    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)
  • FG-IR-24-017 CVE-2024-26007 (5.3 medium) Node.js crash over administrative interface
  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-14T19:07:45.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)

  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command
    • CVE-2023-36640 (6.7 medium)
    • CVE-2023-45583 (6.7 medium)
  • FG-IR-23-465 CVE-2024-23664 (6.1 medium) FortiAuthenticator - Open Redirect on /portal/disclaimer

    • CVE-2024-24549 for Apache Tomcat
    • CVE-2024-30255 for Envoy proxy (nghttp2)
    • CVE-2023-45288 for Golang
    • CVE-2024-28182 for nghttp2
    • CVE-2024-27983 for Node.js
    • CVE-2024-3302 for Firefox
  • FG-IR-23-282 CVE-2023-40720 (7.1 high) IDOR over SIP configuration file
  • FG-IR-24-052 CVE-2024-31493 (6.5 medium) Information disclosure in content hub
  • FG-IR-23-222 Multiple improper input validation and authorization vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-23667 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23668 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23669 (8.8 high)
    • CVE-2024-23670 (8.8 high)

  • FG-IR-23-191 CVE-2024-23107 (5.5 medium) Read only administrator can see passwords' hashes
  • FG-IR-24-054 CVE-2024-31491 (8.8 high) Readonly user could execute sensitive operations
  • FG-IR-23-225 CVE-2023-45586 (5.0 medium) SSL-VPN user IP spoofing
  • FG-IR-24-040 CVE-2024-31488 (6.8 medium) Stored and reflected XSS
  • FG-IR-23-474 CVE-2024-23665 (5.9 medium) Unauthorized ADOM operations

Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet: 21 new vulnerabilities (no mention of exploitation) across 18 advisories:

  • FG-IR-23-415 CVE-2023-46714 (7.2 high) Buffer overflow in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-021 CVE-2024-23105 (7.5 high) Client IP relies on X-Forwarded-For and other headers
  • FG-IR-23-406 CVE-2023-48789 (4.3 medium) Client-side enforcement of server-side security related to customer reports features
  • FG-IR-23-420 CVE-2024-21760 (8.4 high) Code injection in playbook code snippet step
  • FG-IR-23-195 CVE-2023-44247 (6.6 medium) Double free with double usage of json_object_put
  • FG-IR-23-433 CVE-2023-50180 (5.5 medium) Exposure of password hashes to read-only admin
  • FG-IR-23-137 Format String Bug in cli command

#DarkWebInformer #DarkWeb #Exploit #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Infosec #CTI #CVE202431848 #Vulnerability

A prototype PoC for the automation of vulnerability analysis on targets running CData applications on an embedded Jetty server.
